msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Support for caret state in ItemRenderers and List. Focus management puts renderers in the caret state and selectUponNavigation is partly implemented. This is the first step towards getting DropDownList selection/list keyboard navigation work working. Jason will do the integration/refactoring on the List end with a subsequent check-in.
QA: Hold off till Jason's refactoring work comes in
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Turn "on" multiple selection support in List.
Most of the behavior is the same as in Halo except for the following caveats:
-When a multiple selection change occurs, only the selectionChanged event is dispatched with no index information, the multipleSelectionChange flag is true though.

-In Halo when selection was toggled from multiple to single, the view did not update. In Spark, I clear out selection but we can change that if its not desireable (perhaps we should keep the last selected item as the currently selected single item?)
-Binding works for all the selection related properties
-Works programmatically and with the mouse, keyboard hookup will come in a subsequent checkin.
